body.p: If you want to contribute translations to Lenya, you need to know about dictionary files only. If you are a developer, read the key naming conventions too.

section.title: Dictionary Files
section.p:
The latter one is a publication specific translation file which gets merged with the global one. The publication specific translations will override the global ones.
An example name for a dictionary file is cmsui_de.xml or cmsui_fr.xml where _de and _fr are the official locale extensions. If you want to contribute a translation, make a copy of cmsui.xml , add your locale extension to the file name, and translate the text as shown below
When you are done, submit a bug report to Bugzilla and attach your new dictionary file. That way, it gets noticed and can be added to Lenya.

It is considered a good practice to encode the context within the message key. This will avoid key collisions if message catalogies of different contexts are merged. The context should be the key's prefix and MUST always start with "lenya.".

section.p: In the above examples the context is lenya.common which indicates the global context.

section.title: Context Specific Message Keys
section.pre: <message key="lenya.news.main.title">Maintain News</message> <message key="lenya.news.delete.hint">Delete all selected news items.</message>
section.p: It is up to the message author how long(detailed) the context prefix is.
